description.raw:
Fix to [PR #331](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/331/support-model-submissions/diff#comment-126006931) for working with custom local configurations of X1/X2/X3/X4 vehicles.

‌

Right now this is hard-coded to look for the vehicle sensor configurations that are currently available from the remote repository although this could be changed in the future to be more dynamic or allow for reference of a local model over any remote models irregardless of whether the model exists in the cloud or not.  This method will require some bookkeeping in the future as more sensor configurations/model types are added to the cloud.

‌

I tested on the following test cases without issue using a custom WIP vehicle \(x1\_sensor\_config\_6\)

```
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 competition_no_ros.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 competition_no_ros.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix_headless.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix_headless.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true
```

‌

Fix to PR #331 for working with custom local configurations of X1/X2/X3/X4 vehicles.

‌

Right now this is hard-coded to look for the vehicle sensor configurations that are currently available from the remote repository although this could be changed in the future to be more dynamic or allow for reference of a local model over any remote models irregardless of whether the model exists in the cloud or not. This method will require some bookkeeping in the future as more sensor configurations/model types are added to the cloud.

I tested on the following test cases without issue using a custom WIP vehicle (x1_sensor_config_6)

ign launch -v 4 competition_no_ros.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1
ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_6 localModel:=true

ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix_headless.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=x1_sensor_config_1

title.raw: Modications to ignition launch files to accomodate for spawning custom sensor configurations of x1/x2/x3/x4 from localMode.
